name: Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer LLP
membership: American Chamber of Commerce to the European Union; British Chamber of Commerce in Belgium; European Capital Markets Institute; multiple national bar associations.
goal: We are a global law firm with a track record in successfully supporting the world's leading national and multinational corporations, financial institutions and investors. We work on ground breaking and business critical mandates for established organisations, as well as those developing their business or beginning to operate in new markets.
interests: Banking and financial services, Business and Industry, Competition, Consumers, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Energy, Environment, General and Institutional Affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Transport
euInitiatives: Solvency II; Capital Markets Union; Markets in Financial Instruments Directive II; EMIR; Benchmarks Regulation; Packaged Retail Investment Products Directive; Bank Recovery and Resolution Directive; Digital Single Market Strategy; Data Protection Regulation; ePrivacy Regulation; Audiovisual Media Services Directive; Free Flow of Data; Telecoms; Fintech; Internet of Things; Connected Cars; Energy Union; Circular Economy; Foreign Direct Investment; DAC6; Sustainable Finance; Artificial Intelligence; Product Liability
